recipes.name: Crockpot Pepper Steak
recipes.instructions:
Season Beef: Sprinkle beef tips evenly with garlic powder.

Sear: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sear beef for about 5 minutes per side until browned.

Prepare Broth: In a separate container, dissolve the bouillon cube in hot water.

Combine: Transfer the seared beef to the slow cooker. Pour in the bouillon broth.

Add Ingredients: Stir in the green peppers, stewed tomatoes, soy sauce, sugar, and salt.

Slow Cook: Cover and cook on High for 3–4 hours or Low for 6–8 hours.

recipes.name: Jalapeño Popper Chicken Casserole
recipes.instructions:
Prepare Chicken: Cook chicken breast in a slow cooker or pressure cooker until tender. Shred the meat and spread it evenly into a casserole dish.

Preheat & Season: Preheat oven to 375°F. Season the shredded chicken with garlic powder, paprika, and pepper.

Make Sauce: In a separate bowl, whisk together heavy cream, cream cheese, and chicken stock. Pour over the chicken and mix well.

Add Peppers: Fold in the seeded and diced jalapeños.

Add Cheese: Sprinkle a layer of cheddar cheese over the top.

Bake: Bake for 20 minutes total.

Add Bacon: 5 minutes before the timer ends, remove from the oven, sprinkle with bacon bits, and return for the final 5 minutes until bubbly and hot.

Serve: Let cool slightly and enjoy.

recipes.name: Southwestern Quesadillas (Vegetarian)
recipes.instructions:
Sauté Vegetables: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté peppers and onions seasoned with cumin, paprika, and black pepper until softened.

Warm Beans: Heat the refried beans in a bowl until easy to spread.

Assemble Base: For each quesadilla, spread a layer of refried beans onto two tortillas (one for the base, one for the top).

Begin Grilling: Place the bottom tortilla, bean-side up, on a skillet or griddle over medium heat.

Layer Fillings: Spread the sautéed peppers and onions over the beans and sprinkle with a generous amount of cheese. Place the second tortilla on top, bean-side down.

Sear & Flip: Cook for 1–2 minutes until the bottom is browned. Carefully flip and cook the other side for another 1–2 minutes until the cheese is melted and both sides are crisp.

Prepare Sour Cream: In a small bowl, whisk together sour cream and lime juice. Set aside for topping or dipping.

Serve: Slice into wedges and serve with the sour cream mixture.

recipes.name: Bangers & Mash
recipes.instructions:
Roast Sausages: Preheat oven to 400°F. Place sausage links on an aluminum foil-lined baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes.

Sauté: While sausages roast, melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté sliced onions with garlic powder until softened.

Create Sauce: Add flour to the skillet and stir constantly for 1 minute to cook out the raw flour taste.

Simmer Gravy: Gradually pour in beef broth and Worcestershire sauce. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5–10 minutes until thickened.

Prepare Potatoes: Prepare mashed potatoes according to the package directions.

Serve: Plate the sausages over the mashed potatoes and generously top with the onion gravy.

recipes.name: Crockpot 3-Ingredient Meatballs
recipes.instructions:
Mix Sauce: Combine the BBQ sauce and grape jelly in a slow cooker. Stir until well blended.

Coat Meatballs: Add the frozen meatballs to the mixture and toss until they are evenly coated.

Slow Cook: Cover and cook on High for 3 hours.

Serve: Stir once more before serving warm.
